have you tried the Ubuntu LiveCD ?
that's the best place to start looking at linux. The performance will be alot slower than an actual install and things like your video resolution may need some post install tweeking.
I would avoid the 64 bit version of Ubuntu
you probably won't notice any difference between the 64bit and 32bit version unless you do alot of things like compiling software or encoding videos etc..
alot of stuff like flash don't really work out of the box on 64
it is harder to get working on 64bit Ubuntu
your first experience with Ubuntu should be easy, I would recommend you install the 386 version
